designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: A highly mobile species on the very edge of its range in the southern and eastern counties of England. The 19th and early 20th century population in the New Forest may have been a long-established native population, or perhaps a short-term established population following immigration or importation from the continent, but is long extinct â€“ last reported in 1905. The Dorking specimen (1957) was presumably either a vagrant or the result of an importation. Importation may seem unlikely for a species developing in old decayed wood but it is feasible that imported logs may include the accidental decayed log. A new colonization appears to be progressing into eastern England. No sub-fossil remains have yet been found in Britain (Buckland & Buckland, 2006).
